result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Montel Dwayne Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Montel Dwayne Johnson in court with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak appeared on behalf of Annie Louk for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. All parties appear via zoom.
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer from the state. Further, defense requests Final Pre-Trial and Jury Trial Dates. Court grants request and sets 11/22/2022 as deadline for filing trial documents. Case adjourned to Br. 16.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in room 503 of the courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Montel Dwayne Johnson in court with Attorney Michael J Cerniglia; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer R. Guetchidjian. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Defendant Montel Dwayne Johnson in court.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Montel Dwayne Johnson in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Montel Dwayne Johnson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Montel Dwayne Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
